metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25708 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A divide by zero issue was found to occur in libvncserver-0.9.12. A malicious client could use this flaw to send a specially crafted message that, when processed by the VNC server, would lead to a floating point exception, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

vino - 3.22.0-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> vino ships libvncserver source in server/libvncserver

criterions.comment: italc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
vino package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-3ubuntu1.2').
x11vnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
